triples.name: Phonological Rule
triples.relevance: Paper analyzes phonological processes through computational methods and relates to generative and constraint-based phonological frameworks.

triples.name: Formal Language
triples.relevance: Strictly Local functions are defined as a subregular relation within formal language theory, core theoretical foundation for the paper.

triples.name: Automata Theory
triples.relevance: The paper provides automata-theoretic characterization of SL functions using finite-state transduction principles from automata theory.

triples.name: Finite-State Transducer
triples.relevance: Subsequential transduction via FSTs forms the basis for characterizing Strictly Local and subsequential functions.

triples.name: Mealy Machine
triples.relevance: Mealy machines and subsequential transducers form the theoretical basis for SL functions as proper subclasses of subsequential functions.

triples.name: Metathesis
triples.relevance: Metathesis is explicitly cited as one of the phonological processes demonstrated to be Strictly Local.

triples.name: Reduplication
triples.relevance: Local partial reduplication is explicitly mentioned as a process shown to be computationally Strictly Local.

triples.name: Affix
triples.relevance: General affixation is explicitly cited as a phonological/morphological process proven to be Strictly Local.

triples.name: Morphophonology
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes both phonological and morphological processes, bridging phonology and morphology at their interaction.

triples.name: Generative Grammar
triples.relevance: Paper demonstrates that strict locality property is compatible with generative (rule-based) phonological formalisms.

triples.name: Constraint Grammar
triples.relevance: Paper shows strict locality property holds for constraint-based grammatical formalisms, independent of rule-based approaches.

triples.name: Local Language
triples.relevance: Strictly Local formal languages from formal language theory provide theoretical foundation for the paper's SL functions.

triples.name: Computational Linguistics
triples.relevance: Paper applies computational analysis to understand phonological locality, demonstrating how computational methods enhance linguistic understanding.

triples.name: Machine Learning
triples.relevance: Paper presents a novel learning algorithm that provably learns ISL functions using strict locality as an inductive principle.

triples.name: Assimilation
triples.relevance: Assimilation is a fundamental phonological process type related to the local phonological processes analyzed in the paper.
